books.title: Ukridge Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of stories featuring P. G. Wodehouse’s charismatic character Stanley Featherstonehaugh Ukridge.

books.title: After London
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: A young man tries to understand his place in the world as he explores a post-apocalyptic England.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Driven Back to Eden
books.author: Edward Payson Roe
books.summary: A family leaves their crowded New York City flat to find health, happiness, and wholesome work in the countryside.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.

books.title: The Libation Bearers
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: A man is ordered by a god to avenge his father’s murder by killing his mother and her lover.

books.title: The House of Arden
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Two children, with the aid of a magical white mole, travel into the past in search of their family’s long-lost treasure.

books.title: Waverley
books.author: Walter Scott
books.summary: A young English officer becomes involved in the Jacobite rebellion.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Insidious Dr. Fu-Manchu
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: An intrepid detective hunts the criminal mastermind Fu-Manchu through early 20th-century London.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: What Is Art?
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Leo Tolstoy outlines his philosophy of aesthetics.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Ameen Rihani
books.summary: A collection of Ameen Rihani’s poetry.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Philip K. Dick
books.summary: A collection of short works by science fiction legend Philip K. Dick.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fyodor Sologub
books.summary: A collection of Fyodor Sologub’s translated short stories, ordered by date of the publication of their translation.

books.title: Religion and the Rise of Capitalism
books.author: R. H. Tawney
books.summary: A tracing of the development of religious thought from the Middle Ages to the dawn of the Industrial Revolution.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
